The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.

Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned about the fields of various different types of Naval Officers and the life of a person in the Navy in general. This includes leadership (how to lead people; what not to do), personal experiences, work/life balance, and cool career and mission sets.
Learned more about what it means to be a sailor/Marine in the military today.
Naval science skills preparing me to be a good officer towards my sailors.
Chain of Command and various briefings.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Overall, Naval Science Lab is very well designed for students in Naval ROTC. It is a simple, low-time-commitment lab where you usually sit down and listen to interesting people discuss their experiences in/with regard to the Navy. Additionally, some labs are more engaging and hands-on, like workshops, the Leadership Reaction Course, 

One big thing that could be improved is the diversity of the speakers or the people that are invited to the lab. After someone in the chain-of-command mentioned that we should invite more people of color to speak, a company commander immediately refuted him and said that we shouldn't base things on diversity, but on merit instead, which is totally uncalled for.
Great speakers this semester. More engaging than in previous years.
Lab was the best it had been, so no meaningful improvements.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! Even if you are not in NROTC (in which this is required), I still recommend this course to anyone who is interested in learning more about the perspectives of people in the Navy, or even current things that are happening in the militar.
Yes! If you are at all interested in the military, I would encourage you to try ROTC. It could change your life!
Not exactly a course; also only permissible for NROTC midshipmen to take.
